trans-unit.source: Powered by the TELS Research Community and WISE Open Source Technology.
trans-unit.target: Powered by the TELS Research Community and WISE Open Source Technology.

trans-unit.source: This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation. Any opinions, findings, and conclusions or recommendations expressed in this material are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Science Foundation.

trans-unit.source: ©1996-2018, UC Berkeley | Web-based Inquiry Science Environment
trans-unit.target: ©1996-2018, UC Berkeley | Web-based Inquiry Science Environment

trans-unit.source: Integrated science learning and teaching with technology
trans-unit.target: Integrated science learning and teaching with technology

trans-unit.source: Free, standards-aligned, and research-based inquiry curricula that address NGSS 3D proficiency
trans-unit.target: Free, standards-aligned, and research-based inquiry curricula that address NGSS 3D proficiency

trans-unit.source: Ready to try WISE in the Classroom?
trans-unit.target: Ready to try WISE in the Classroom?

trans-unit.source: A powerful online platform for designing, developing, and implementing science inquiry units
trans-unit.target: A powerful online platform for designing, developing, and implementing science inquiry units

trans-unit.source: Since 1997, WISE has served a growing community of more than 20,000 teachers, researchers, and curriculum designers, as well as over 200,000 K-12 students around the world.
trans-unit.target: Since 1997, WISE has served a growing community of more than 20,000 teachers, researchers, and curriculum designers, as well as over 200,000 K-12 students around the world.

trans-unit.source: Pose relevant questions and make predictions
trans-unit.target: Pose relevant questions and make predictions

trans-unit.source: Construct explanations through reflection and discussion
trans-unit.target: Construct explanations through reflection and discussion

trans-unit.source: WISE engages students in the methods of real scientists and engineers. We take a multidisciplinary approach so that students learn inquiry through activities that emphasize essential skills in reading, writing, and multimedia literacy. Many of our units are also project-based and feature hands-on design challenges.
trans-unit.target: WISE engages students in the methods of real scientists and engineers. We take a multidisciplinary approach so that students learn inquiry through activities that emphasize essential skills in reading, writing, and multimedia literacy. Many of our units are also project-based and feature hands-on design challenges.

trans-unit.source: With WISE inquiry units, students not only learn skills that prepare them to be successful in STEM. They also learn skills necessary to be responsible, critical thinking citizens.
trans-unit.target: With WISE inquiry units, students not only learn skills that prepare them to be successful in STEM. They also learn skills necessary to be responsible, critical thinking citizens.

trans-unit.source: WISE offers a growing collection of curriculum units that address key conceptual difficulties students encounter in science. Units are carefully crafted to supplement teachers' core curricular scope and sequence and are iteratively refined through classroom-based research.
trans-unit.target: WISE offers a growing collection of curriculum units that address key conceptual difficulties students encounter in science. Units are carefully crafted to supplement teachers' core curricular scope and sequence and are iteratively refined through classroom-based research.

trans-unit.source: WISE units support the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS), encourage 3-dimensional learning, and can be adapted to address local standards.
trans-unit.target: WISE units support the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS), encourage 3-dimensional learning, and can be adapted to address local standards.

trans-unit.source: WISE provides a simple user interface, cognitive hints, embedded assessments, and online discussions, as well as tools for drawing, annotation, concept mapping, diagramming, and graphing.
trans-unit.target: WISE provides a simple user interface, cognitive hints, embedded assessments, and online discussions, as well as tools for drawing, annotation, concept mapping, diagramming, and graphing.

trans-unit.source: Students conduct investigations using interactive simulations and models. A notebook tool helps students collect ideas and organize evidence into research and design reports. WISE units promote self-monitoring through collaborative reflection activities as well as automated, personalized guidance and adaptive instruction.
trans-unit.target: Students conduct investigations using interactive simulations and models. A notebook tool helps students collect ideas and organize evidence into research and design reports. WISE units promote self-monitoring through collaborative reflection activities as well as automated, personalized guidance and adaptive instruction.

trans-unit.source: WISE offers an extensive suite of integrated tools that help teachers plan, monitor progress, gain insights, provide feedback, and grade more efficiently. These tools are continually refined through collaborations with practicing teachers who understand the real challenges of managing modern classrooms.
trans-unit.target: WISE offers an extensive suite of integrated tools that help teachers plan, monitor progress, gain insights, provide feedback, and grade more efficiently. These tools are continually refined through collaborations with practicing teachers who understand the real challenges of managing modern classrooms.

trans-unit.source: By facilitating these necessary but time-consuming tasks, teachers are free to focus on what makes them indispensable: providing quality instruction to individual students.
trans-unit.target: By facilitating these necessary but time-consuming tasks, teachers are free to focus on what makes them indispensable: providing quality instruction to individual students.

trans-unit.source: Grade and give feedback + sample scoring rubrics
trans-unit.target: Grade and give feedback + sample scoring rubrics

trans-unit.source: Authoring environment that supports customization and creation of new units
trans-unit.target: Authoring environment that supports customization and creation of new units

trans-unit.source: In development: Automated insights into student NGSS understanding + suggested classroom interventions!
trans-unit.target: In development: Automated insights into student NGSS understanding + suggested classroom interventions!

trans-unit.source: Explore what WISE has to offer!
trans-unit.target: Explore what WISE has to offer!

trans-unit.source: WISE is the product of more than 25 years of research on teaching and learning with educational technologies
trans-unit.target: WISE is the product of more than 25 years of research on teaching and learning with educational technologies

trans-unit.source: Based on Research, Refined Through Practice
trans-unit.target: Based on Research, Refined Through Practice

trans-unit.source: Through our collaborations with teachers, administrators, technology designers, and education researchers, we have refined a set of principles which guide the design of all WISE curriculum materials and tools.
trans-unit.target: Through our collaborations with teachers, administrators, technology designers, and education researchers, we have refined a set of principles which guide the design of all WISE curriculum materials and tools.

trans-unit.source: This means that when implementing WISE units, you can be assured that what you're using is grown from a solid foundation, advised by real teachers' experiences, and tested in classrooms with real students.
trans-unit.target: This means that when implementing WISE units, you can be assured that what you're using is grown from a solid foundation, advised by real teachers' experiences, and tested in classrooms with real students.

trans-unit.source: As students grapple with multiple conflicting and confusing ideas, research has shown that instruction is most effective when student views are used as a starting point for scientific investigations.
trans-unit.target: As students grapple with multiple conflicting and confusing ideas, research has shown that instruction is most effective when student views are used as a starting point for scientific investigations.

trans-unit.source: WISE units introduce students to complex science concepts through personally and socially relevant topics. Each unit uses a classroom-tested pattern of instruction that values the ideas students bring with them, helps them connect new information to their personal experiences, and integrates their ideas into a coherent understanding of science.
trans-unit.target: WISE units introduce students to complex science concepts through personally and socially relevant topics. Each unit uses a classroom-tested pattern of instruction that values the ideas students bring with them, helps them connect new information to their personal experiences, and integrates their ideas into a coherent understanding of science.

trans-unit.source: Individual students differ in their experiences, interests, and abilities. WISE provides a variety of tools, activity patterns, and instructional scaffolds that afford multiple ways for expressing and assessing understanding. That way, no students' abilities go unrecognized, and all have the chance to succeed.
trans-unit.target: Individual students differ in their experiences, interests, and abilities. WISE provides a variety of tools, activity patterns, and instructional scaffolds that afford multiple ways for expressing and assessing understanding. That way, no students' abilities go unrecognized, and all have the chance to succeed.

trans-unit.source: WISE gives more teachers and students the opportunity to do inquiry-based science. Our units make difficult concepts accessible both for teachers to teach and students to learn. WISE curricula help students see themselves as capable of doing science and realize that, no matter their backgrounds, science can be a potential career.
trans-unit.target: WISE gives more teachers and students the opportunity to do inquiry-based science. Our units make difficult concepts accessible both for teachers to teach and students to learn. WISE curricula help students see themselves as capable of doing science and realize that, no matter their backgrounds, science can be a potential career.

trans-unit.source: WISE is free and open source! WISE subsists on generous support from the National Science Foundation, which means it's available to anyone with an internet connection. Driven by an active community of developers, WISE is continually being expanded and improved. Bring science inquiry into the classroom, the museum, the after-school, or the home-school environment!
trans-unit.target: WISE is free and open source! WISE subsists on generous support from the National Science Foundation, which means it's available to anyone with an internet connection. Driven by an active community of developers, WISE is continually being expanded and improved. Bring science inquiry into the classroom, the museum, the after-school, or the home-school environment!

trans-unit.source: WISE Terms of Use & Privacy Policy
trans-unit.target: WISE Terms of Use & Privacy Policy

trans-unit.source: We understand how important privacy is to our community, especially the teachers and students all over the world who use WISE resources in their educational endeavors. This policy explains what information we collect, how we use it, and what we do to keep it safe.
trans-unit.target: We understand how important privacy is to our community, especially the teachers and students all over the world who use WISE resources in their educational endeavors. This policy explains what information we collect, how we use it, and what we do to keep it safe.

trans-unit.source: These Terms of Use and Privacy Policy constitute an agreement between you and the Web-based Inquiry Science Environment team that governs your use of wise.berkeley.edu and all associated services and websites (collectively "WISE"). The WISE team is a federally-funded research group headquartered at the University of California, Berkeley and is a non-profit organization.
trans-unit.target: These Terms of Use and Privacy Policy constitute an agreement between you and the Web-based Inquiry Science Environment team that governs your use of wise.berkeley.edu and all associated services and websites (collectively "WISE"). The WISE team is a federally-funded research group headquartered at the University of California, Berkeley and is a non-profit organization.

trans-unit.source: Please read this document carefully. By using WISE you affirm that you have read, understood, and accepted the terms and conditions outlined here. If you do not agree with any of these conditions, please do not use WISE. If you have questions about this policy, please feel free to contact us using our Contact Form.
trans-unit.target: Please read this document carefully. By using WISE you affirm that you have read, understood, and accepted the terms and conditions outlined here. If you do not agree with any of these conditions, please do not use WISE. If you have questions about this policy, please feel free to contact us using our Contact Form.

trans-unit.source: This policy was last updated on September 8, 2017.
trans-unit.target: This policy was last updated on September 8, 2017.

trans-unit.source: In order to use some features of WISE, you will need to register by creating a user account. Creating an account is optional, but without an account you will not be able to create or publish curriculum projects or use WISE curricula to capture, store, review, or assess student work.
trans-unit.target: In order to use some features of WISE, you will need to register by creating a user account. Creating an account is optional, but without an account you will not be able to create or publish curriculum projects or use WISE curricula to capture, store, review, or assess student work.

trans-unit.source: When creating a WISE teacher account, we ask you to provide your first and last name, email address, password, city, state, country, school name, school level, and school subjects. To create a WISE student account, we ask you to provide your first and last name, birth day and month, gender, and password, and choose a security question and answer.
trans-unit.target: When creating a WISE teacher account, we ask you to provide your first and last name, email address, password, city, state, country, school name, school level, and school subjects. To create a WISE student account, we ask you to provide your first and last name, birth day and month, gender, and password, and choose a security question and answer.

trans-unit.source: To help ensure unauthorized use of your account, please keep your password secret. You are solely responsible for any use of your account, even if your account is used by another person. If any use of your account violates the Terms of Use, your account may be suspended or deleted.
trans-unit.target: To help ensure unauthorized use of your account, please keep your password secret. You are solely responsible for any use of your account, even if your account is used by another person. If any use of your account violates the Terms of Use, your account may be suspended or deleted.

trans-unit.source: If you believe that your account is no longer secure for any reason, please change your password. If you cannot access your account to change your password, contact us using our Contact Form.
trans-unit.target: If you believe that your account is no longer secure for any reason, please change your password. If you cannot access your account to change your password, contact us using our Contact Form.

trans-unit.source: When students submit work in a WISE project run (while logged into their accounts), we save their responses to questions and any content they create within the WISE platform. Teachers can review the responses and artifacts students create in the WISE runs they own. Teachers can also grade student work and provide feedback. Scores and comments generated by teachers through the WISE platform are stored by WISE and can be viewed by the students they are sent to.
trans-unit.target: When students submit work in a WISE project run (while logged into their accounts), we save their responses to questions and any content they create within the WISE platform. Teachers can review the responses and artifacts students create in the WISE runs they own. Teachers can also grade student work and provide feedback. Scores and comments generated by teachers through the WISE platform are stored by WISE and can be viewed by the students they are sent to.

trans-unit.source: Curriculum projects that teachers author using the WISE platform are also saved and stored on our servers and may be published to a public project library that is accessible to other WISE users or visitors (with the owner's permission). Please note: Every WISE project hosted by the WISE site (whether it is shared in a public project library or not) is viewable by anyone using the internet via the project's unique URL.
trans-unit.target: Curriculum projects that teachers author using the WISE platform are also saved and stored on our servers and may be published to a public project library that is accessible to other WISE users or visitors (with the owner's permission). Please note: Every WISE project hosted by the WISE site (whether it is shared in a public project library or not) is viewable by anyone using the internet via the project's unique URL.

trans-unit.source: Some sections or features of WISE may allow you to share information concerning your opinions, experiences, or preferences about WISE content or other topics. For example, you might be able to voluntarily review or rate WISE resources, answer user questions, designate favorite WISE projects, respond to surveys, share personal information or social media profile links to your public WISE profile, etc. Information you provide will be stored by WISE and may be shared with other WISE users either anonymously or not (as long as you provide permission). Unless otherwise expressly provided for in this policy, WISE shall have no liability to you or to any third party with respect to information submitted voluntarily by you via the WISE site.
trans-unit.target: Some sections or features of WISE may allow you to share information concerning your opinions, experiences, or preferences about WISE content or other topics. For example, you might be able to voluntarily review or rate WISE resources, answer user questions, designate favorite WISE projects, respond to surveys, share personal information or social media profile links to your public WISE profile, etc. Information you provide will be stored by WISE and may be shared with other WISE users either anonymously or not (as long as you provide permission). Unless otherwise expressly provided for in this policy, WISE shall have no liability to you or to any third party with respect to information submitted voluntarily by you via the WISE site.

trans-unit.source: All projects that you create on or share to the WISE site shall be licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 license. For more information about the terms of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/. The WISE team reserves the right to remove any content that, in the WISE team's discretion, is harmful to the community or violates the WISE Terms of Use. Harmful use includes spam or repeated commercial advertisement through projects, comments, or discussion posts, as well as inappropriate or offensive material.
trans-unit.target: All projects that you create on or share to the WISE site shall be licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 license. For more information about the terms of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/. The WISE team reserves the right to remove any content that, in the WISE team's discretion, is harmful to the community or violates the WISE Terms of Use. Harmful use includes spam or repeated commercial advertisement through projects, comments, or discussion posts, as well as inappropriate or offensive material.

trans-unit.source: You may link to or include outside resources or materials in your WISE projects or in any public parts of the WISE site, but it is your responsibility to obtain any necessary permission from the original owners and include any required attribution for your use of such content. WISE will not be held responsible for the unauthorized use by a WISE account holder of any third-party content in WISE projects or on any other sections of the WISE site.
trans-unit.target: You may link to or include outside resources or materials in your WISE projects or in any public parts of the WISE site, but it is your responsibility to obtain any necessary permission from the original owners and include any required attribution for your use of such content. WISE will not be held responsible for the unauthorized use by a WISE account holder of any third-party content in WISE projects or on any other sections of the WISE site.

trans-unit.source: When students and teachers use WISE, we save event data such as mouse clicks, time spent viewing pages, and other site interactions. This data is used for research purposes and for automated analyses and tools within WISE project runs. (See ‘How We Use the Data' for more information.)
trans-unit.target: When students and teachers use WISE, we save event data such as mouse clicks, time spent viewing pages, and other site interactions. This data is used for research purposes and for automated analyses and tools within WISE project runs. (See ‘How We Use the Data' for more information.)

trans-unit.source: When you log in, WISE will ask your browser to put a "cookie" on your computer. This allows WISE to remember that you are logged in when you go to a different page. You can delete this cookie at any time through your browser's settings.
trans-unit.target: When you log in, WISE will ask your browser to put a "cookie" on your computer. This allows WISE to remember that you are logged in when you go to a different page. You can delete this cookie at any time through your browser's settings.

trans-unit.source: WISE uses Google Analytics to help us understand our site usage. We use data like which pages you visit and clicks you make to help us improve the site. Information collected and processed by Google Analytics includes user IP addresses, network locations, and geographic locations. Some browsers allow you to opt-out of the Google Analytics tracking by installing add-ons for your browser.
trans-unit.target: WISE uses Google Analytics to help us understand our site usage. We use data like which pages you visit and clicks you make to help us improve the site. Information collected and processed by Google Analytics includes user IP addresses, network locations, and geographic locations. Some browsers allow you to opt-out of the Google Analytics tracking by installing add-ons for your browser.

trans-unit.source: We will not sell your information to anyone under any circumstances.
trans-unit.target: We will not sell your information to anyone under any circumstances.

trans-unit.source: The WISE team uses de-identified user data to perform research. Researchers in the Graduate School of Education at The University of California at Berkeley and partner institutions may use de-identified data to perform data analyses and explore research topics. This data includes both user-generated and auto-generated content (see 'Information We Collect' section). Results of our research may be shared with educators and other researchers through conferences, journals, and other publications.
trans-unit.target: The WISE team uses de-identified user data to perform research. Researchers in the Graduate School of Education at The University of California at Berkeley and partner institutions may use de-identified data to perform data analyses and explore research topics. This data includes both user-generated and auto-generated content (see 'Information We Collect' section). Results of our research may be shared with educators and other researchers through conferences, journals, and other publications.

trans-unit.source: When generating and analyzing research data, student names are removed from all student work and replaced with identification numbers. This process of replacing names with identification numbers is performed automatically by the WISE platform when exporting research data and will be performed by teachers if any other student work (e.g., from other instructional materials) is to be analyzed by researchers.
trans-unit.target: When generating and analyzing research data, student names are removed from all student work and replaced with identification numbers. This process of replacing names with identification numbers is performed automatically by the WISE platform when exporting research data and will be performed by teachers if any other student work (e.g., from other instructional materials) is to be analyzed by researchers.

trans-unit.source: Email addresses for teacher accounts are used for communication: (a) for support, and (b) for occasional public announcements from the WISE Team. Teacher email addresses are also used to facilitate resetting of passwords.
trans-unit.target: Email addresses for teacher accounts are used for communication: (a) for support, and (b) for occasional public announcements from the WISE Team. Teacher email addresses are also used to facilitate resetting of passwords.

trans-unit.source: We do not ask students for their email address and do not share any student personal information with outside parties. Only the students' teachers can access student names and usernames within WISE (for purposes of reviewing student work, grading, sending feedback, etc). Each participating teacher will have access to his or her own students' project work and will not be able to see any information from other teachers' students. Teachers are also able to reset passwords for their students.
trans-unit.target: We do not ask students for their email address and do not share any student personal information with outside parties. Only the students' teachers can access student names and usernames within WISE (for purposes of reviewing student work, grading, sending feedback, etc). Each participating teacher will have access to his or her own students' project work and will not be able to see any information from other teachers' students. Teachers are also able to reset passwords for their students.

trans-unit.source: A small set of WISE administrators are able to access user account information and data for support and technical purposes. A few select researchers may access teacher accounts to view anonymized student work or support teachers in setting up and managing projects and runs.
trans-unit.target: A small set of WISE administrators are able to access user account information and data for support and technical purposes. A few select researchers may access teacher accounts to view anonymized student work or support teachers in setting up and managing projects and runs.

trans-unit.source: We will not disclose your personally identifying information to any other parties except in the following cases: 1) In cases where you (or a legal guardian) have provided your express consent; 2) As required by applicable law; or 3) With the appropriate authorities (including schools, school districts, and law enforcement, when necessary) for the purposes of protecting the safety of users, other individuals, or the security of the site.
trans-unit.target: We will not disclose your personally identifying information to any other parties except in the following cases: 1) In cases where you (or a legal guardian) have provided your express consent; 2) As required by applicable law; or 3) With the appropriate authorities (including schools, school districts, and law enforcement, when necessary) for the purposes of protecting the safety of users, other individuals, or the security of the site.

trans-unit.source: WISE promotes and supports freedom of speech and expression and strives to create a welcoming, supportive, and productive community of educators and learners.
trans-unit.target: WISE promotes and supports freedom of speech and expression and strives to create a welcoming, supportive, and productive community of educators and learners.

trans-unit.source: You may not use WISE to promote bigotry, discrimination, hatred, or violence against any individual or group. You may not expose any other person's identifying or contact information without that person's permission. Threatening, harassing, or intimidating any other person is not allowed and we reserve the right to remove any user-generated content that, in our discretion, does so. Projects, discussion posts, and user-profile pages containing offensive or sexually explicit material will not be tolerated and removed from the site immediately once brought to the attention of the WISE team.
trans-unit.target: You may not use WISE to promote bigotry, discrimination, hatred, or violence against any individual or group. You may not expose any other person's identifying or contact information without that person's permission. Threatening, harassing, or intimidating any other person is not allowed and we reserve the right to remove any user-generated content that, in our discretion, does so. Projects, discussion posts, and user-profile pages containing offensive or sexually explicit material will not be tolerated and removed from the site immediately once brought to the attention of the WISE team.

trans-unit.source: You may not deliberately perform actions that are intended to negatively affect the WISE website or its users. You may not post links to harmful sites to download viruses or malware.
trans-unit.target: You may not deliberately perform actions that are intended to negatively affect the WISE website or its users. You may not post links to harmful sites to download viruses or malware.

trans-unit.source: All user-generated content is provided as-is. The WISE Team is not responsible for the accuracy or reliability of any user-generated content available through WISE. The WISE Team does not endorse any views, opinions, or advice expressed in user-generated content. You agree to relieve the WISE Team of any and all liability arising from your user-generated content.
trans-unit.target: All user-generated content is provided as-is. The WISE Team is not responsible for the accuracy or reliability of any user-generated content available through WISE. The WISE Team does not endorse any views, opinions, or advice expressed in user-generated content. You agree to relieve the WISE Team of any and all liability arising from your user-generated content.

trans-unit.source: If you notice any offensive material or user-generated content that are in violation with the rules above, please report them to the WISE Team using our Contact Form.
trans-unit.target: If you notice any offensive material or user-generated content that are in violation with the rules above, please report them to the WISE Team using our Contact Form.

trans-unit.source: The security of your information is important to us and we try to maintain a high standard for security by using technical safeguards. We will try our best to keep your data safe. However, no system can ever be 100% secure so we can not guarantee your personal information will be 100% safe from unauthorized access, either while stored on our site or our databases or while being transmitted to WISE over the internet.
trans-unit.target: The security of your information is important to us and we try to maintain a high standard for security by using technical safeguards. We will try our best to keep your data safe. However, no system can ever be 100% secure so we can not guarantee your personal information will be 100% safe from unauthorized access, either while stored on our site or our databases or while being transmitted to WISE over the internet.

trans-unit.source: You can help us protect against unauthorized access to your account by choosing a strong password and keeping your password secret at all times.
trans-unit.target: You can help us protect against unauthorized access to your account by choosing a strong password and keeping your password secret at all times.

trans-unit.source: If you live in California and are under the age of 18 or the parent or legal guardian of a student under the age of 18, you may request the removal of your information from our site. When you request removal of your information, we will remove all your personal information to the best of our ability. Please note that we may not be able to remove all de-identified information or pieces of content stored in our databases and we may not remove content that we are required to retain under applicable federal and state laws. If you would like to request removal of your or your child's content or information, please contact us at https://wise.berkeley.edu/contact for assistance or you can delete specific information from you or your child's account.
trans-unit.target: If you live in California and are under the age of 18 or the parent or legal guardian of a student under the age of 18, you may request the removal of your information from our site. When you request removal of your information, we will remove all your personal information to the best of our ability. Please note that we may not be able to remove all de-identified information or pieces of content stored in our databases and we may not remove content that we are required to retain under applicable federal and state laws. If you would like to request removal of your or your child's content or information, please contact us at https://wise.berkeley.edu/contact for assistance or you can delete specific information from you or your child's account.

trans-unit.source: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA)
trans-unit.target: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA)

trans-unit.source: We take care to be familiar with FERPA legislation and we take all possible measures to ensure your compliance with FERPA's requirements when you use WISE. We are confident that the protection of data outlined in this document satisfies its requirements.
trans-unit.target: We take care to be familiar with FERPA legislation and we take all possible measures to ensure your compliance with FERPA's requirements when you use WISE. We are confident that the protection of data outlined in this document satisfies its requirements.

trans-unit.source: 7. Changes and Updates to the Terms of Use & Privacy Policy
trans-unit.target: 7. Changes and Updates to the Terms of Use & Privacy Policy

trans-unit.source: We may occasionally update or modify our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. We will always display the date this document was last updated. If we make significant changes to these terms, we will display a prominent notice on the WISE home page and may notify users via registered email. We encourage you to review this document periodically. By continuing to use WISE after any changes to this document, you acknowledge that you agree to the current version of these terms.
trans-unit.target: We may occasionally update or modify our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. We will always display the date this document was last updated. If we make significant changes to these terms, we will display a prominent notice on the WISE home page and may notify users via registered email. We encourage you to review this document periodically. By continuing to use WISE after any changes to this document, you acknowledge that you agree to the current version of these terms.

trans-unit.source: If you have any questions or concerns about this document or the WISE site, please contact us using our Contact Form. We can also be reached by mail at:
trans-unit.target: If you have any questions or concerns about this document or the WISE site, please contact us using our Contact Form. We can also be reached by mail at:

trans-unit.source: UC Berkeley Graduate School of Education
trans-unit.target: UC Berkeley Graduate School of Education

trans-unit.source: All users must create their own account. Teachers must create a teacher account and students must create a student account. Users can create an account by going to the WISE Home Page and clicking on the Register link at the upper right of the screen.
trans-unit.target: All users must create their own account. Teachers must create a teacher account and students must create a student account. Users can create an account by going to the WISE Home Page and clicking on the Register link at the upper right of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Here are instructions on how to create a teacher account.
trans-unit.target: Here are instructions on how to create a teacher account.

trans-unit.source: Go to the WISE Home Page.
trans-unit.target: Go to the WISE Home Page.

trans-unit.source: Click the Register link at the upper right of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Click the Register link at the upper right of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Choose to sign up with your email or with your Google Account.
trans-unit.target: Choose to sign up with your email or with your Google Account.

trans-unit.source: Fill out the form and submit it.
trans-unit.target: Fill out the form and submit it.

trans-unit.source: If you created an account using your email, you will be given a username that you will need to remember. Your username will be your first name and your last name with no space inbetween. There may be a number added at the end of your username if someone has the same name as you.
trans-unit.target: If you created an account using your email, you will be given a username that you will need to remember. Your username will be your first name and your last name with no space inbetween. There may be a number added at the end of your username if someone has the same name as you.

trans-unit.source: To use a WISE unit with your class, you must first choose a unit to use and then set up a "Run" of that unit.
trans-unit.target: To use a WISE unit with your class, you must first choose a unit to use and then set up a "Run" of that unit.

trans-unit.source: Here are instructions on how to set up a Run.
trans-unit.target: Here are instructions on how to set up a Run.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to WISE with your teacher account.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to WISE with your teacher account.

trans-unit.source: Find a project that you would like to use with your class.
trans-unit.target: Find a project that you would like to use with your class.

trans-unit.source: Click on the project to open the information for the project.
trans-unit.target: Click on the project to open the information for the project.

trans-unit.source: Choose the periods you will use the project in.
trans-unit.target: Choose the periods you will use the project in.

trans-unit.source: Choose the number of students per team. Choosing 1-3 will allow students to work together in a team.
trans-unit.target: Choose the number of students per team. Choosing 1-3 will allow students to work together in a team.

trans-unit.source: Choose the start date. Students will not be able to use the project until this date.
trans-unit.target: Choose the start date. Students will not be able to use the project until this date.

trans-unit.source: The run will be created and added to your Teacher Home.
trans-unit.target: The run will be created and added to your Teacher Home.

trans-unit.source: Copy the "Access Code" for the new run and write it down somewhere like on the white board. Students will need to use this access code to work on the run you created.
trans-unit.target: Copy the "Access Code" for the new run and write it down somewhere like on the white board. Students will need to use this access code to work on the run you created.

trans-unit.source: How do I create an account?
trans-unit.target: How do I create an account?

trans-unit.source: How do I use a unit with my class?
trans-unit.target: How do I use a unit with my class?

trans-unit.source: Should I register my students for WISE or have them do it themselves?
trans-unit.target: Should I register my students for WISE or have them do it themselves?

trans-unit.source: WISE makes student registration simple and intuitive -- direct your students to the register page by having them go to the WISE home page and clicking the "Register" link at the upper right. They should be able to register in 10 minutes or less. However, you can also opt to pre-register all of your students and provide them with a copy of their Username/Password on their first day in the project run.
trans-unit.target: WISE makes student registration simple and intuitive -- direct your students to the register page by having them go to the WISE home page and clicking the "Register" link at the upper right. They should be able to register in 10 minutes or less. However, you can also opt to pre-register all of your students and provide them with a copy of their Username/Password on their first day in the project run.

trans-unit.source: Once a student has created a WISE account they should never need to create another one.
trans-unit.target: Once a student has created a WISE account they should never need to create another one.

trans-unit.source: Some teachers that pre-register prefer to give all students the same initial password, to decrease problems with students signing in. This is ok, but for security purposes, we advise that you have the students change their passwords once they log in.
trans-unit.target: Some teachers that pre-register prefer to give all students the same initial password, to decrease problems with students signing in. This is ok, but for security purposes, we advise that you have the students change their passwords once they log in.

trans-unit.source: A student has forgotten his/her Username or Password. What should I do?
trans-unit.target: A student has forgotten his/her Username or Password. What should I do?

trans-unit.source: First, we recommend always having students WRITE DOWN their Username/Password when they first register.
trans-unit.target: First, we recommend always having students WRITE DOWN their Username/Password when they first register.

trans-unit.source: Second, encourage the students to solve the problem themselves. Tell them to go to the WISE home page, click the Lost Username/Password link, and click the Student button. If the student can answer their security question (created at registration) they can change their password.
trans-unit.target: Second, encourage the students to solve the problem themselves. Tell them to go to the WISE home page, click the Lost Username/Password link, and click the Student button. If the student can answer their security question (created at registration) they can change their password.

trans-unit.source: Third, if the student can't solve the problem directly, you can change their password for them using the instructions below.
trans-unit.target: Third, if the student can't solve the problem directly, you can change their password for them using the instructions below.

trans-unit.source: How do I change a student's password?
trans-unit.target: How do I change a student's password?

trans-unit.source: Sign into WISE with your teacher account.
trans-unit.target: Sign into WISE with your teacher account.

trans-unit.source: Find the run in your Teacher Home Page.
trans-unit.target: Find the run in your Teacher Home Page.

trans-unit.source: Click the "Teacher Tools" button on the run.
trans-unit.target: Click the "Teacher Tools" button on the run.

trans-unit.source: Click on the "Manage Students" icon on the left side bar.
trans-unit.target: Click on the "Manage Students" icon on the left side bar.

trans-unit.source: Find the period the student is in.
trans-unit.target: Find the period the student is in.

trans-unit.source: Find the student and click "Change Password".
trans-unit.target: Find the student and click "Change Password".

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can change the password for ALL students in the current period (the new password will be applied to all the students in the period).
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can change the password for ALL students in the current period (the new password will be applied to all the students in the period).

trans-unit.source: How do I change a student team after they've started a project run?
trans-unit.target: How do I change a student team after they've started a project run?

trans-unit.source: Drag-and-drop student names to move them from one team to another. Make sure to save your changes before leaving this window.
trans-unit.target: Drag-and-drop student names to move them from one team to another. Make sure to save your changes before leaving this window.

trans-unit.source: If you want to move students into a brand new team, click New Team, then drag 1 or more students into the new team. Save your changes.
trans-unit.target: If you want to move students into a brand new team, click New Team, then drag 1 or more students into the new team. Save your changes.

trans-unit.source: If you move Student A into an established team, student A loses all of their current work and inherits the current work of the established team.
trans-unit.target: If you move Student A into an established team, student A loses all of their current work and inherits the current work of the established team.

trans-unit.source: If you move Student A into a newly created (blank) team, student A will lose all of their work.
trans-unit.target: If you move Student A into a newly created (blank) team, student A will lose all of their work.

trans-unit.source: How do I change the period for a student?
trans-unit.target: How do I change the period for a student?

trans-unit.source: A popup will show up that will allow you to choose a different period for the student.
trans-unit.target: A popup will show up that will allow you to choose a different period for the student.

trans-unit.source: If you move a student to a different period, they will lose all of their work.
trans-unit.target: If you move a student to a different period, they will lose all of their work.

trans-unit.source: I do not remember my teacher access code that students need to create their account for my new students.
trans-unit.target: I do not remember my teacher access code that students need to create their account for my new students.

trans-unit.source: The Access Code will be displayed below the run title.
trans-unit.target: The Access Code will be displayed below the run title.

trans-unit.source: When should I set up my project run?
trans-unit.target: When should I set up my project run?

trans-unit.source: You need to set up your project run anytime before the students can start working on the project. They will need the Access Code for the run in order to start working.
trans-unit.target: You need to set up your project run anytime before the students can start working on the project. They will need the Access Code for the run in order to start working.

trans-unit.source: How long does it take to run a project?
trans-unit.target: How long does it take to run a project?

trans-unit.source: Project durations vary from about 3 days to 10 days. Some projects may display an estimation of the number of hours it will take for students to complete the project.
trans-unit.target: Project durations vary from about 3 days to 10 days. Some projects may display an estimation of the number of hours it will take for students to complete the project.

trans-unit.source: Can I shorten a project run to 1 or 2 days?
trans-unit.target: Can I shorten a project run to 1 or 2 days?

trans-unit.source: It is not recommended to shorten a project. Each project has been carefully designed to lead the student through an inquiry process and cutting it short will result in a less satisfactory educational student experience. Nevertheless, if you are under a time constraint and knowledgeable of the project topic, you could customize the project and shorten it to your specific needs.
trans-unit.target: It is not recommended to shorten a project. Each project has been carefully designed to lead the student through an inquiry process and cutting it short will result in a less satisfactory educational student experience. Nevertheless, if you are under a time constraint and knowledgeable of the project topic, you could customize the project and shorten it to your specific needs.

trans-unit.source: Where do I find out about lesson plans and standards for WISE projects?
trans-unit.target: Where do I find out about lesson plans and standards for WISE projects?

trans-unit.source: Find a project you would like to learn about.
trans-unit.target: Find a project you would like to learn about.

trans-unit.source: This will display a popup that displays information about the project.
trans-unit.target: This will display a popup that displays information about the project.

trans-unit.source: Note: Some projects may not have much information because it is dependent on the author to provide the lesson plan and standards.
trans-unit.target: Note: Some projects may not have much information because it is dependent on the author to provide the lesson plan and standards.

trans-unit.source: How do I fit a WISE project into my curriculum?
trans-unit.target: How do I fit a WISE project into my curriculum?

trans-unit.source: In general students will benefit from some pre-teaching of the topic covered in the project. It is really up to the teacher to decide where it best fits to support student learning. Many teachers use a WISE project as a capstone activity while others integrate it into their curriculum at a midpoint. Some teachers elect to use WISE projects an introductory activity for a unit, or as a summation activity for a unit.
trans-unit.target: In general students will benefit from some pre-teaching of the topic covered in the project. It is really up to the teacher to decide where it best fits to support student learning. Many teachers use a WISE project as a capstone activity while others integrate it into their curriculum at a midpoint. Some teachers elect to use WISE projects an introductory activity for a unit, or as a summation activity for a unit.

trans-unit.source: How do I add a period after creating a run?
trans-unit.target: How do I add a period after creating a run?

trans-unit.source: On the run, click the three vertical dots to view the run options.
trans-unit.target: On the run, click the three vertical dots to view the run options.

trans-unit.source: Enter a period name in the "Add New Period" field.
trans-unit.target: Enter a period name in the "Add New Period" field.

trans-unit.source: How do I delete a period after creating a run?
trans-unit.target: How do I delete a period after creating a run?

trans-unit.source: Find the period you want to delete and click the "Delete" button next to it.
trans-unit.target: Find the period you want to delete and click the "Delete" button next to it.

trans-unit.source: Note: You are not allowed to delete a period that has students in it.
trans-unit.target: Note: You are not allowed to delete a period that has students in it.

trans-unit.source: What if I run out of computer lab time but some of my students are not finished with the project?
trans-unit.target: What if I run out of computer lab time but some of my students are not finished with the project?

trans-unit.source: WISE is a web-based learning environments, so students can sign in from a computer at school or at home. This means that students can complete the project from any home or community based computer, per the teacher's discretion.
trans-unit.target: WISE is a web-based learning environments, so students can sign in from a computer at school or at home. This means that students can complete the project from any home or community based computer, per the teacher's discretion.

trans-unit.source: How do I review and grade student work?
trans-unit.target: How do I review and grade student work?

trans-unit.source: Here you will be able to look at your students' work.
trans-unit.target: Here you will be able to look at your students' work.

trans-unit.source: On the left sidebar you can choose to look at the work by step by clicking "Grade By Step" or you can choose to look at the work by team by clicking "Grade By Team".
trans-unit.target: On the left sidebar you can choose to look at the work by step by clicking "Grade By Step" or you can choose to look at the work by team by clicking "Grade By Team".

trans-unit.source: Next to each student's work, you will be able to give them a score and comment.
trans-unit.target: Next to each student's work, you will be able to give them a score and comment.

trans-unit.source: How do students see my comments and scores for their work?
trans-unit.target: How do students see my comments and scores for their work?

trans-unit.source: The student must sign into WISE with their student account.
trans-unit.target: The student must sign into WISE with their student account.

trans-unit.source: Go to the step that the teacher graded.
trans-unit.target: Go to the step that the teacher graded.

trans-unit.source: The comment and score will be displayed under the piece of work that was graded.
trans-unit.target: The comment and score will be displayed under the piece of work that was graded.

trans-unit.source: What should I look for in my student's answers?
trans-unit.target: What should I look for in my student's answers?

trans-unit.source: The following link will give you a sample rubric for grading a step in the Mitosis and Cell Processes project. The rubric is based on our TELS Center research on how students integrate their knowledge of complex science concepts. We hope that it can give you a start in developing your own rubrics for the notes and steps you plan to grade.
trans-unit.target: The following link will give you a sample rubric for grading a step in the Mitosis and Cell Processes project. The rubric is based on our TELS Center research on how students integrate their knowledge of complex science concepts. We hope that it can give you a start in developing your own rubrics for the notes and steps you plan to grade.

trans-unit.source: Sample rubric for assessing student work
trans-unit.target: Sample rubric for assessing student work

trans-unit.source: How can I encourage my students to review the graded notes and comments I have made?
trans-unit.target: How can I encourage my students to review the graded notes and comments I have made?

trans-unit.source: Many teachers find it advantageous to grade the first step or two at the end of the first day of the project run. At the beginning of class the next day they share with the whole class some sample responses and have the class critique the work.
trans-unit.target: Many teachers find it advantageous to grade the first step or two at the end of the first day of the project run. At the beginning of class the next day they share with the whole class some sample responses and have the class critique the work.

trans-unit.source: How do I find time to grade all of the student work?
trans-unit.target: How do I find time to grade all of the student work?

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you go through the project and select a few steps that you think best demonstrate the students' understanding of the complex concepts covered in the module and grade those steps. Then tell your students they must complete all questions but should concentrate their efforts on the key steps. We recognize that critically grading each step is very time consuming and unpractical.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you go through the project and select a few steps that you think best demonstrate the students' understanding of the complex concepts covered in the module and grade those steps. Then tell your students they must complete all questions but should concentrate their efforts on the key steps. We recognize that critically grading each step is very time consuming and unpractical.

trans-unit.source: What is the Real Time Classroom Monitor?
trans-unit.target: What is the Real Time Classroom Monitor?

trans-unit.source: The Real Time Classroom Monitor allows teachers to view student progress in real time. Teachers will be able to see what step a student is on, how much time the student has spent on that step, and how much of the project the student has completed. All of this information will be updated immediately in real time as students work on the project.
trans-unit.target: The Real Time Classroom Monitor allows teachers to view student progress in real time. Teachers will be able to see what step a student is on, how much time the student has spent on that step, and how much of the project the student has completed. All of this information will be updated immediately in real time as students work on the project.

trans-unit.source: Does the Real Time Classroom Monitor work on a tablet like the iPad?
trans-unit.target: Does the Real Time Classroom Monitor work on a tablet like the iPad?

trans-unit.source: Can I use the Real Time Classroom Monitor to pause student screens?
trans-unit.target: Can I use the Real Time Classroom Monitor to pause student screens?

trans-unit.source: Yes you can! This can be useful if you need to grab their attention in order to have a class discussion or to make an announcement.
trans-unit.target: Yes you can! This can be useful if you need to grab their attention in order to have a class discussion or to make an announcement.

trans-unit.source: The WISE web site won't load on my web browser. What do I do?
trans-unit.target: The WISE web site won't load on my web browser. What do I do?

trans-unit.source: You can try clearing your browser cache and then reloading the WISE web site.
trans-unit.target: You can try clearing your browser cache and then reloading the WISE web site.

trans-unit.source: You can try using a different web browser. We recommend using Chrome or Firefox.
trans-unit.target: You can try using a different web browser. We recommend using Chrome or Firefox.

trans-unit.source: How many computers do I need to run WISE?
trans-unit.target: How many computers do I need to run WISE?

trans-unit.source: We strongly recommend one computer for every two students. Research shows that students benefit from working together as a team of two.
trans-unit.target: We strongly recommend one computer for every two students. Research shows that students benefit from working together as a team of two.

trans-unit.source: What if I have trouble logging in?
trans-unit.target: What if I have trouble logging in?

trans-unit.source: If you do not remember your Username or password click the Lost Username or Password link and follow the instructions.
trans-unit.target: If you do not remember your Username or password click the Lost Username or Password link and follow the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Can I use WISE in another language?
trans-unit.target: Can I use WISE in another language?

trans-unit.source: Click on your account icon at the top right of the page. This should open a drop down with options.
trans-unit.target: Click on your account icon at the top right of the page. This should open a drop down with options.

trans-unit.source: Near the bottom there will be a "Language" setting.
trans-unit.target: Near the bottom there will be a "Language" setting.

trans-unit.source: Change the language to the language of your choice.
trans-unit.target: Change the language to the language of your choice.

trans-unit.source: Note 1: If your language is not listed as an option, or you'd like to help us improve the translation, please contact us and we'll help you get started!
trans-unit.target: Note 1: If your language is not listed as an option, or you'd like to help us improve the translation, please contact us and we'll help you get started!

trans-unit.source: Note 2: Changing the language will change the language of the website but will not change the language of the projects. Projects must be independently translated which means that if you want to use a project in another language, you must translate it yourself or find a version of the project that has been translated by someone else.
trans-unit.target: Note 2: Changing the language will change the language of the website but will not change the language of the projects. Projects must be independently translated which means that if you want to use a project in another language, you must translate it yourself or find a version of the project that has been translated by someone else.

trans-unit.source: Who do I contact when I have a problem I can't solve?
trans-unit.target: Who do I contact when I have a problem I can't solve?

trans-unit.source: The Contact WISE form will send an email to the WISE technology group. You can find a link to the form at the bottom of the home page. Be sure to include as much information as you can about the problem. We will respond as quickly as we can.
trans-unit.target: The Contact WISE form will send an email to the WISE technology group. You can find a link to the form at the bottom of the home page. Be sure to include as much information as you can about the problem. We will respond as quickly as we can.

trans-unit.source: I forgot my username, how can I find it?
trans-unit.target: I forgot my username, how can I find it?

trans-unit.source: Go to the forgot username page and follow the instructions to retrieve your username.
trans-unit.target: Go to the forgot username page and follow the instructions to retrieve your username.

trans-unit.source: I forgot my password, how can I change it?
trans-unit.target: I forgot my password, how can I change it?

trans-unit.source: Go to the forgot password page and follow the instructions to reset your password.
trans-unit.target: Go to the forgot password page and follow the instructions to reset your password.

trans-unit.source: How do I start working on a project?
trans-unit.target: How do I start working on a project?

trans-unit.source: In order to start working on a project you must obtain an Access Code from your teacher. Once you have an Access Code, follow the directions below.
trans-unit.target: In order to start working on a project you must obtain an Access Code from your teacher. Once you have an Access Code, follow the directions below.

trans-unit.source: Log into WISE with your student account.
trans-unit.target: Log into WISE with your student account.

trans-unit.source: Click on the "Add Unit" button at the top right of the Student Home Page.
trans-unit.target: Click on the "Add Unit" button at the top right of the Student Home Page.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Access Code from your teacher.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Access Code from your teacher.

trans-unit.source: The run will be added to your list of runs.
trans-unit.target: The run will be added to your list of runs.

trans-unit.source: I chose the wrong period, how can I change it?
trans-unit.target: I chose the wrong period, how can I change it?

trans-unit.source: Only your teacher can change your period. Please ask them for assistance.
trans-unit.target: Only your teacher can change your period. Please ask them for assistance.

trans-unit.source: Sign into WISE with your student account.
trans-unit.target: Sign into WISE with your student account.

trans-unit.source: Explore suggested WISE curricula for the given grade levels or search for specific units that address your needs.
trans-unit.target: Explore suggested WISE curricula for the given grade levels or search for specific units that address your needs.

trans-unit.source: Explore suggested WISE curricula for the given grade levels or search for specific units that address your needs.
trans-unit.target: Explore suggested WISE curricula for the given grade levels or search for specific units that address your needs.

trans-unit.source: Suggested unit sequences developed and tested by the WISE team
trans-unit.target: Suggested unit sequences developed and tested by the WISE team

trans-unit.source: Units designed and shared by WISE community members
trans-unit.target: Units designed and shared by WISE community members

trans-unit.source: Units owned by or shared with you
trans-unit.target: Units owned by or shared with you

trans-unit.source: For "Period 9", just enter the number 9. Separate periods with commas (e.g. "Section 1, Section 2"). Manually named periods should be no more than 16 characters long.
trans-unit.target: For "Period 9", just enter the number 9. Separate periods with commas (e.g. "Section 1, Section 2"). Manually named periods should be no more than 16 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Success! This unit has been added to your Class Schedule.
trans-unit.target: Success! This unit has been added to your Class Schedule.

trans-unit.source: Important: Every classroom unit has a unique Access Code. Students use this code to register for a unit. Give the code to your students when they first sign up for a WISE account. If they already have WISE accounts, have them log in and then select "Add Unit" from the student home page.
trans-unit.target: Important: Every classroom unit has a unique Access Code. Students use this code to register for a unit. Give the code to your students when they first sign up for a WISE account. If they already have WISE accounts, have them log in and then select "Add Unit" from the student home page.

trans-unit.source: You can always find the Access Code for each classroom unit in your Class Schedule.
trans-unit.target: You can always find the Access Code for each classroom unit in your Class Schedule.

trans-unit.source: Copying creates a duplicate that will appear in “My Units”. You will be the owner and can edit the content and share the new unit with other WISE users.
trans-unit.target: Copying creates a duplicate that will appear in “My Units”. You will be the owner and can edit the content and share the new unit with other WISE users.

trans-unit.source: Username and password not recognized. Please try again.
trans-unit.target: Username and password not recognized. Please try again.

trans-unit.source: New to WISE? Join for free!
trans-unit.target: New to WISE? Join for free!

trans-unit.source: Your Google User ID was not found in WISE.
trans-unit.target: Your Google User ID was not found in WISE.

trans-unit.source: We’ll never share your email address or personal information with anyone without your consent.
trans-unit.target: We’ll never share your email address or personal information with anyone without your consent.

trans-unit.source: Please enter a valid email address
trans-unit.target: Please enter a valid email address

trans-unit.source: How did you hear about us?
trans-unit.target: How did you hear about us?

trans-unit.source: I agree to the WISE Privacy Policy & Terms of Use *
trans-unit.target: I agree to the WISE Privacy Policy & Terms of Use *

trans-unit.source: You must agree to the Privacy Policy & Terms of Use
trans-unit.target: You must agree to the Privacy Policy & Terms of Use

trans-unit.source: Your WISE account has been created!
trans-unit.target: Your WISE account has been created!

trans-unit.source: You should receive an email with your account details shortly.
trans-unit.target: You should receive an email with your account details shortly.

trans-unit.source: You should also receive an email with your account details.
trans-unit.target: You should also receive an email with your account details.

trans-unit.source: By clicking "Create Account", you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms of Use
trans-unit.target: By clicking "Create Account", you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms of Use

trans-unit.source: Please write this down. You will need it when signing in to WISE in the future.
trans-unit.target: Please write this down. You will need it when signing in to WISE in the future.

trans-unit.source: Hi! There is already a WISE user with this Google account.
trans-unit.target: Hi! There is already a WISE user with this Google account.

trans-unit.source: You have already added this unit.
trans-unit.target: You have already added this unit.

trans-unit.source: Hey there! Looks like you don't have any WISE units yet.
trans-unit.target: Hey there! Looks like you don't have any WISE units yet.

trans-unit.source: Ask your teacher for an Access Code and then tap the Add Unit button to get started.
trans-unit.target: Ask your teacher for an Access Code and then tap the Add Unit button to get started.

trans-unit.source: Hey there! Looks like you haven't run any WISE units in your classes yet.
trans-unit.target: Hey there! Looks like you haven't run any WISE units in your classes yet.

trans-unit.source: Select "Browse Units" to find titles to use with your students.
trans-unit.target: Select "Browse Units" to find titles to use with your students.

trans-unit.source: Teacher is already on shared list.
trans-unit.target: Teacher is already on shared list.

trans-unit.source: Are you sure you want to end the unit? This will prevent your students from adding to or changing their work. You can continue to review and grade.
trans-unit.target: Are you sure you want to end the unit? This will prevent your students from adding to or changing their work. You can continue to review and grade.

trans-unit.source: The unit has been successfully ended.
trans-unit.target: The unit has been successfully ended.

trans-unit.source: There was an error ending this unit. Please try again later.
trans-unit.target: There was an error ending this unit. Please try again later.

trans-unit.source: This is the name your students will see.
trans-unit.target: This is the name your students will see.

trans-unit.source: Your message has been sent. We will get back to you as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: Your message has been sent. We will get back to you as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: Sorry, there was a problem submitting the form. Please try again.
trans-unit.target: Sorry, there was a problem submitting the form. Please try again.

trans-unit.source: Your password has been successfully changed. Click the button below to sign in.
trans-unit.target: Your password has been successfully changed. Click the button below to sign in.

trans-unit.source: Your username has been sent to your email. Once you have received your username, you can use the button below to go to the sign in page.
trans-unit.target: Your username has been sent to your email. Once you have received your username, you can use the button below to go to the sign in page.

trans-unit.source: We have sent a verification code to your email. Please check your email and enter the verification code below.
trans-unit.target: We have sent a verification code to your email. Please check your email and enter the verification code below.
